incidents.name: Console not Taking Account Upgrade After Being Completed

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have identified an issue with the upgrade flow in Console where customers still see the "Upgrade" button available after completing the upgrade of the account and are working to deploy a fix. As a workaround, customers can do a hard refresh in the browser and then the console will reflect the upgraded state. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified an issue with the upgrade flow in Console where customers still see the "Upgrade" button available after completing the upgrade of the account and are working to deploy a fix. As a workaround, customers can do a hard refresh in the browser and then the console will reflect the upgraded state. We expect to provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Elevated HTTP 500 and 503 Status Codes on the Create, Check, Update, and Fetch Verifications Endpoints of the Verify API

incident_updates.body: Twilio Verify was degraded for 29 minutes between 16:05 and 16:34 Pacific Time on 02/28/2025. During this period of time customers may have experienced elevated HTTP 500 and 503 status codes on the create, check, update, and fetch Verifications endpoints of the Twilio Verify API. The issue has now been resolved.
There were elevated HTTP 500 and 503 status codes on the create, check, update, and fetch Verifications endpoints have resolved and Twilio Verify API is operating normally at this time.

We are investigating a service interruption with the Twilio Verify API where we are experiencing elevated HTTP 500 and 503 status codes on the create, check, update, and fetch Verifications endpoint. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue causing elevated HTTP 500 and 503 status codes on the create, check, update, and fetch Verifications endpoints of the Verify API. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
